Name: Blackwisp Egret
AbilitiyScores: Str 4, Dex 15, Con 11, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 5
SpecialAbilities: Deceptive Target (Ex) A blackwisp egret's glowing eyes belie its true position at night. In areas of dim light or darkness, ranged attacks against a blackwisp egret suffer a 20% miss chance.

Name: Exoskeleton Giant Cockroach
AbilitiyScores: Str 13, Dex 12, Con -, Int -, Wis 10, Cha 10

Name: Skittergoat
AbilitiyScores: Str 12, Dex 14, Con 11, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 5
SpecialAbilities: Egg Cracker (Ex) A skittergoat's horns are able to crack through the tough shells of ankheg eggs. When a skittergoat charges, its gore attack is resolved against the target's touch AC. In addition, when breaking an object, a skittergoat ignores 1 point of the object's hardness.

Name: Flood Troll
AbilitiyScores: Str 15, Dex 18, Con 16, Int 8, Wis 11, Cha 7
SpecialAbilities: Absorbent Hide (Ex) A flood troll's flesh is highly resilient to the stresses of long dry periods. A flood troll who has gone without touching flowing water for at least 24 hours gains a +2 natural armor bonus to AC. A flood troll who has touched water within the last 24 hours gains cold resistance 5 instead.  Oversized Limbs (Ex) A flood troll's hands are larger than its body would suggest. Flood trolls can wield Large weapons without penalty.  Rain Regeneration (Ex) A flood troll's regeneration functions as long as the flood troll is touching flowing water or precipitation. Even a slight drizzle is enough to activate the flood troll's regeneration. However, any acid or fire damage dealt to the flood troll suspends its next round of regeneration.

Name: Mindspin Ram
AbilitiyScores: Str 12, Dex 17, Con 13, Int 2, Wis 14, Cha 7

Name: Embolotherium
AbilitiyScores: Str 26, Dex 11, Con 18, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 3

Name: Chalicotherium
AbilitiyScores: Str 24, Dex 11, Con 18, Int 2, Wis 11, Cha 5

Name: Deinotherium
AbilitiyScores: Str 29, Dex 9, Con 22, Int 2, Wis 13, Cha 4
SpecialAbilities: Sweep (Ex) A deinotherium can sweep a target with its downward-curving tusks and knock the victim to the ground. As part of a charge, a deinotherium can move up to twice its base speed in a straight line and make a gore attack at any point during its movement. If this attack is successful, the target is knocked prone and the deinotherium can deal damage with its trample attack before continuing its movement.
